greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Total sum A(n,k) of lengths of longest contiguous subsequences with the same value over all s in {1,...,n}^k; square array A(n,k), n>=0, k>=0, read by antidiagonals.
link: Alois P. Heinz, Antidiagonals n = 0..140, flattened
maple: b:= proc(n, m, s, i) option remember; `if`(m>i or s>m, 0,
A:= (n, k)-> add(m*add(b(n, m, s, k), s=1..m), m=1..k):
mathematica: b[n_, m_, s_, i_] := b[n, m, s, i] = If[m>i || s>m, 0, If[i == 0, 1, If[i == 1, n, If[s == 1, (n-1)*Sum[b[n, m, h, i-1], {h, 1, m}], b[n, m, s-1, i-1] + If[s == m, b[n, m-1, s-1, i-1], 0]]]]]; A[n_, k_] := Sum[m*Sum[b[n, m, s, k], {s, 1, m}], {m, 1, k}]; Table[Table[A[n, d-n], {n, 0, d}], {d, 0, 12}] // Flatten (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Jan 19 2015, after _Alois P. Heinz_ *)
results.author: _Alois P. Heinz_, Aug 18 2013
